newsitem.title: USA: American Financial tenders for notes.
newsitem.headline: American Financial tenders for notes.

text.p: American Financial Group Inc said on Wednesday its American Premier Underwriters unit is making a tender offer that expires January 3, 1997 for $256 million of its subordinated notes.

The company is tendering for its 9-3/4 percent subordinated notes due August 1, 1999, 10-5/8 percent Subordinated Notes due April 15, 2000 and 10-7/8 percent Subordinated Notes due May 1, 2011, American Financial said.
The purchase price will be the greater of a set minimum price, or based upon a fixed spread over the yield of comparable U.S. Treasury securities, American Financial said.

The 9-3/4 percent notes will have a minimum price of $1,070 per $1,000 in principal and will be paid the equivalent yield of 90 basis points over U.S. treasury security 6.875 percent due August 31, 1999, American Financial said.
The miminum purchase price for $1,000 of principal of the 10-5/8 percent notes will be $1,110, or to yield 90 basis points over the 6.75 percent Treasury security due April 30, 2000.

The 10-7/8 percent notes will have a minimum price of $1,240 per $1,000 in principal, or will be purchased at a price yielding 170 basis points over the 6.50 percent U.S. Treasury security due October 15, 2006, American Financial said.
